intro: Rubus glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered blackberry, is a species of brambles native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Rubus glomeratus is often found in woodland edges, thickets, and along stream banks.
